required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Neurotensin - an Important Regulator of Appetite in Humans?
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Neurotensin on Appetite, Food Intake, Blood Glucose Regulation, Hormone Secretion, and the Degradation of Neurotensin in Vivo

brief_summary.textblock:
Neurotensin (NT) is a gut peptide released postprandially from the small intestine. It is known to exert a range of enterogastrone effects and in animal models it reduces food intake when administered by parenteral routes.
This study investigates whether the anorexic effects of NT suggested by animal studies can be translated.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants will be studied on multiple occasions (5 days) in a randomised and double blinded fashion. One day will serve as an acclimatization day.
study_design_info.masking_description: Participants will not be informed of the nature of the infusion they are administered on any of the study days. The investigator will be provided with an infusion (either isotonic saline with HSA or isotonic salin with HSA + neurotensin) prepared by a designated colleague

primary_outcome.measure: Ad libitum food intake (ad libitum days)
primary_outcome.description: Neurotensin (NT) and saline will be infused on two occasions in random order, double blinded. After 1h of infusion an ad libitum meal will be served. When the meal is completed food intake will be determined by weighing the leftovers.

primary_outcome.measure: Ad libitum food intake (liquid meal + ad libitum days)
primary_outcome.description: Neurotensin (NT) and saline will be infused on two occasions in random order, double blinded. 1h into the infusions a standardized liquid mixed meal will be ingested. After another 180 min an ad libitum meal will be served. When the meal is completed food intake will be determined by weighing the leftovers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Appetite and gastrointestinal sensations (ad libitum days)
secondary_outcome.description: Using visual analogue scales (VAS) the effect of infusions and meals will be documented. Ad libitum meals will also be evaluated using VAS.

secondary_outcome.measure: Appetite and gastrointestinal sensations (liquid meal + ad libitum days)
secondary_outcome.description: Using visual analogue scales (VAS) the effect of infusions and meals will be documented. Ad libitum meals will also be evaluated using VAS.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma glucose (liquid meal + ad libitum days)
bile acids (liquid meal + ad libitum days)
Glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1) (liquid meal + ad libitum days)
Glucose-dependent insulinotropic polypeptide (GIP) (liquid meal + ad libitum days)
Peptide YY (PYY) (liquid meal + ad libitum days)
Pancreatic polypeptide (PP) (liquid meal + ad libitum days)

clinical_study.condition: Physiology - Regulation of Appetite and Food Intake

arm_group.description: This will serve as the placebo / control day for the NT + ad libitum meal study day.
Neurotensin (NT) infusion followed by an ad libitum meal to study the effect of NT on ad libitum food intake.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Saline + liquid meal + ad libitum meal
arm_group.description: Saline infusion followed a standardized liquid mixed meal followed by an ad libitum meal. This will serve as the placebo / control day for the NT + standardized liquid mixed meal + ad libitum meal study day. Investigating the effect of NT on the second meal effect.

arm_group.arm_group_label: NT + liquid meal + ad libitum meal
arm_group.description: NT infusion followed a standardized liquid mixed meal followed by an ad libitum meal. This study day aims to study the effect of NT on the second meal effect.

intervention.arm_group_label: NT + liquid meal + ad libitum meal
Saline + liquid meal + ad libitum meal

intervention.description: Participants will be served a large meal serving. They will be instructed to eat until they do not feel hungry anymore.
intervention.arm_group_label: Saline + liquid meal + ad libitum meal
NT + liquid meal + ad libitum meal

intervention.description: A standardized mixed liquid meal will be ingested to stimulate endogenous peptide hormone release
intervention.arm_group_label: Saline + liquid meal + ad libitum meal
NT + liquid meal + ad libitum meal

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age = or above 18 years
- normal haemoglobin levels
- male
- informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diabetes mellitus (fasting plasma glucose or HbA1c)
- Familiy history of diabetes mellitus
- Intestinal disease (incl e.g. inflammatory bowel disease and malabsorbtion)
- Family history of inflammatory bowel disease
- Previous intestinal resection
- Body mass index (BMI) over 25 kg/m2
- Smoker
- Nephropathy (S-creatinine> 130 μM)
- Liver disease (ALAT and/or ASAT > 2 × upper normal limit)
